availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, farmer. Henry County, Kentucky, native. Married to Martha Ann Mowrie Carpenter Ransdall in Henry County, Kentucky, on September 21, 1852. Father of Ernest Frank Ransdall. Farmer in Henry County in 1850. Farmer in Henry County in 1860. Employed J. T. Ball as a laborer in Henry County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Henry County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision 2, p. 195A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Port Royal, p. 368B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Film # 994038: Henry County Marriages, 1852, p. 1 of 17 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1965), KDLA, Film # 7019169: All Counties: Jefferson County, 1932, File #16622, p. 131 of 3314 of microfilm.
Find A Grave, “William "Stukey" Ransdall (1813-1896)," Memorial # 66361986, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/66361986/william-h.-ransdell (accessed April 30, 2021).KYR-0001-029-0561.
